title: Urban Outfitters typeface used on their webiste?
content:
Hey, i was just wondering if anyone would know what the typeface is used on the Urban Outfitters website. It would be a great help....

[http://www.urbanoutfitters.co.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016013655/http:/www.urbanoutfitters.co.uk/ "http://www.urbanoutfitters.co.uk/")

THANKS!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Urban Outfitters.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016013655/http:/typophile.com/files/Urban%20Outfitters.png) | 2.16 KB |
author: Randalf

comments.content:
[p22 Underground Thin Small Caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016013655/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/underground-basic/thin-small-caps/) look to be the one.

greetings Jeffrey  
 [infraordinaire](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016013655/http:/www.infraordinaire.com/wordpress)
Nope it's not. The hunt is still on.

Very close to [Agenda Thin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016013655/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/agenda/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D34%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DGUTEN%2520TAG%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dot.liga%26seed%3D25) from Font Bureau. The short middle arm of the E is the hardest part to match and Agenda's is a bit shorter, at least. The G chin is the only other noteworthy detail in these letters, and it is relatively low. Unfortunately this G shape is probably the most common, so it's all about the amount of closure and the proportions of the chin relative to the rest of the letter.

- Mike Yanega
